ta.aseloader
Class J3DObject

java.lang.Object
  ta.aseloader.J3DObject
public class J3DObject
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a "bridge" between the file loader and Java3D. This class has a function so it can be added to the branch graph in Java3D, it is capable of checking a line collision with the faces in the model and it can be used to animate a model fairly easy.

setInterpolatedFrame

public void setInterpolatedFrame(int p_frame_source,
                                 int p_frame_target,
                                 float p_ip)
Set a frame, or an interpolated frame.

Parameters:
p_frame_source - The index of the base frame to interpolate from
p_frame_target - The index of the target frame
p_ip - The interpolation value, should vary from 0 to 1, where numbers in between will result in an interpolated frame.

useTransform

public void useTransform(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D p_t3d)
Sets a transform for the model, but does not apply it. Should be used if animation is in use, that way the transform won't be applied twice to the model. If you use the setTransform() function, you will multiply the model with the passed transform, which is not necessary if you are doing animation, since the animation function calls the setTransform() function as well. This function only sets a transform to use whenever an animation/setframe function is called.

Parameters:
p_t3d - Transform to use for model
See Also:
setTransform(Transform3D p_t3d)

setTransform

public void setTransform(javax.media.j3d.Transform3D p_t3d)
Multiplies the model data with the passed transform. This function is required to use if collision-detection is wanted.

Parameters:
p_t3d - The transform you would use on your geometry to make it rotate, move etc.

getObject

public javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup getObject()
Returns:
The model's TransformGroup, which can be used directly in Java3D to add the model to the branch graph.

getFrameCount

public int getFrameCount()
Returns:
Returns the number of frames this model consists of.

getFrame

public int getFrame()
Returns the current frame. If the current frame is an interpolated frame, it returns the frame index of the first source frame passed to the setInterpolatedFrame() function.

Returns:
Current frame index. If the frame is an interpolated frame, the last passed "source frame" is returned.

getCollisionPointNear

public javax.vecmath.Point3f getCollisionPointNear()
Returns:
The the nearest collision point, or null if there were no collisions the last time lineCollision was called.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

getCollisionPointFar

public javax.vecmath.Point3f getCollisionPointFar()
Returns:
The the farthest collision point, or null if there were no collisions the last time lineCollision was called.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

getCollisionNormalNear

public javax.vecmath.Vector3f getCollisionNormalNear()
Returns:
The normal for the nearest collision point, or null if there were no collisions the last time lineCollision was called.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

getCollisionNormalFar

public javax.vecmath.Vector3f getCollisionNormalFar()
Returns:
The normal for the farthest collision point, or null if there were no collisions the last time lineCollision was called.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

getCollisionPoints

public javax.vecmath.Point3f[] getCollisionPoints()
Returns:
An array of the collision points. If there were no collision the last time lineCollision was called, null is returned. Use the returned value from lineCollision to traverse through the array.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

getCollisionNormals

public javax.vecmath.Vector3f[] getCollisionNormals()
Returns:
An array of the normals for each collision point. If there were no collisions, null is returned. Use the returned value from lineCollision to traverse through the array.
See Also:
lineCollision(float p_x1, float p_y1, float p_z1, float p_x2, float p_y2, float p_z2)

lineCollision

public int lineCollision(float p_x1,
                         float p_y1,
                         float p_z1,
                         float p_x2,
                         float p_y2,
                         float p_z2)
Checks to see whether or not the passed line segment crosses one the triangles the model consists of. Please note that this function will only work correctly if: The model has been transformed using this class' setTransform() function, or if the model is untransformed.

Parameters:
p_x1 - Line start x coordinate
p_y1 - Line start y coordinate
p_z1 - Line start z coordinate
p_x2 - Line end x coordinate
p_y2 - Line end y coordinate
p_z2 - Line end z coordinate
Returns:
-1 if error, otherwise it will return the number of collisions

lineCollisionY

public int lineCollisionY(float p_x1,
                          float p_y1,
                          float p_z1,
                          float p_depth)
Casts a line straight down and up from the point passed, in p_length in both directions. Stores the collisions points as the lineCollision()-function does. This function will be better to use for surface following than the above, because this function is a lot faster. Please note that this function will only work correctly if: The model has been transformed using this class' setTransform() function, or if the model is untransformed.

Parameters:
p_x1 - X Coordinate of point to test for height collision
p_y1 - Y Coordinate
p_z1 - Z Coordinate
p_depth - Collision test length in both directions
Returns:
-1 if error, otherwise it will return the number of collisions

getObjectFaceData

public ObjectFaceData[] getObjectFaceData()
Returns an ObjectFaceData array containing the model's facedata. Each entry in the array is one part of the model. The model is split up in different objects by texture, so each object will have only one texture.

Returns:
An array of facedata objects

export

public void export(java.lang.String p_filename)
Exports all frames to a simple textfile format on disk.

Parameters:
p_filename - File to store model data in

protected static void out(java.lang.String p_str)
